speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: "I foresee a rock affair between superstar Madonna and super-witness Kato Kaelin." Well, that's a gimme, that's not really going out on a limb, is it? "I foresee Author J.D. Salinger finally publishing a new novel and hitting the talk show circuit to promote it." Hmmm... that's just playing the odds. "I foresee the revelation that not Elvis, but rather Buddy Holly is still alive, having faked his own death so many years ago. Holly will not only reemerge but also regroup with the Crickets and they will headline in next year's Lalapalaza..." Lalapaz... pazoola? What the hell is Lalapalazo?

speaker: CLERK
line: Who's Buddy Holly?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Just give me my lotto ticket and, uh, a pint of malt scotch whiskey.

speaker: CLERK
line: Anything else?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Yeah. One of these. "That'll be the day when I die... that'll be the day..." Sorry.

speaker: PUPPET
line: Don't apologize. You're a better dancer than my last date.

speaker: MADAME ZELMA
line: So, what has brought you to Madame Zelma?

speaker: PUPPET
line: Well... can you really know everything about me just by looking at my hands?

speaker: MADAME ZELMA
line: Mm-hmm. The palms tell me all.

speaker: PUPPET
line: I would just like for you to be able to tell me why I am going to be doing the things I'm going to be doing?

speaker: MADAME ZELMA
line: Madame Zelma, she is a palm reader, not a psychologist.

speaker: PUPPET
line: I know, I know, it's just... I think I've somehow caught a glimpse of my own future, myself. And I see me doing things that... that just seem so out of character for me. I mean, these are things that not only do I not want to be doing, but I can't even imagine myself capable of doing and yet, there I am. I'm doing them.

speaker: MADAME ZELMA
line: Mister... please, you're hurting me.

speaker: PUPPET
line: I know, I know... and I'm sorry. But you're a fortune teller.

speaker: MADAME ZELMA
line: No...

speaker: PUPPET
line: You should've seen this coming.

speaker: MADAME ZELMA
line: Please...

speaker: WOMAN ON APB WIRE
line: Unit seven, unit seven...

speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
line: They say the eyes capture the last image the murder victim sees before they're killed.

speaker: CLINE
line: So what do they say about the entrails?

speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
line: Yuck.

speaker: HAVEZ
line: Is it true you asked for some help in this case?

speaker: CLINE
line: This guy's supposed to be an expert at this sort of thing.

speaker: HAVEZ
line: I heard he was a bit... unorthodox.

speaker: CLINE
line: He comes highly recommended.

speaker: HAVEZ
line: Yeah. I saw him on TV.

speaker: CLINE
line: Hey, so he's a publicity hound. As long as he gets results.

speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
line: I once worked on a case he did. Very spooky.

speaker: CLINE
line: As long as he gives us leads, I don't care how big a kook.

speaker: POLICEMAN
line: Sir, right in here, please.

speaker: CLINE
line: Who the hell are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm Agent Mulder. This is Agent Scully.

speaker: CLINE
line: Oh, I forgot you were coming aboard. I'm, uh, Cline, this is Havez.

speaker: HAVEZ
line: We're thinking this guy might be a satanist, what with the eyeballs.

speaker: MULDER
line: Satanists take the eyeballs and leave the body, not vice-versa. Not in anything but modern myths.

speaker: CLINE
line: He's gouging eyes for no reason?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, nobody does anything without a reason. We've already composed a profile of the killer. We offer possible explanations for the nature of his attacks and also his choice of victims.

speaker: CLINE
line: Does it explain the entrails?

speaker: MULDER
line: Anthropomancy. It was once believed that you could divine your future by vivisecting a human being and studying the entrails.

speaker: HAVEZ
line: So this guy is hacking up people in order to see his future?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there's a possible connection with all of his victims being professional prognosticators.

speaker: CLINE
line: Till this one. She was a professional doll collector.

speaker: MULDER
line: And an amateur tasseographer. She read tea leaves. After drinking the tea, you can gain insight into your future by examining the pattern of the leaves on the bottom of the cup.

speaker: CLINE
line: You believe in this stuff?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not convinced of its accuracy but I'm pretty sure the victim was.

speaker: CLINE
line: Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Her leaves were telling her she was about to be murdered.

speaker: POLICEMAN
line: Right this way, sir... You're going to have to stand back, all right? This is official police business.

speaker: CLINE
line: Mister Yappi, I appreciate you coming all the way down here...

speaker: YAPPI
line: Quiet! Yes, I'm seeing visions. Visions of the killer. He does not feel like he is in control of his own life. Very important. That's why he kills, yes!

speaker: CLINE
line: Can you see what he looks like?

speaker: YAPPI
line: He looks like... A white man with facial hair. Or not. But he has... yes! A tattoo! Somewhere on his body. Maybe the tattoo has the facial hair. I think. Hmm! I see him here! Forcing himself, yes! On the girl! But he cannot perform... so he's taking out his rage. It's gone. I lost the vision. Someone is blocking me. I am picking up negative energy. Please leave this room.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm part of this investigation.

speaker: YAPPI
line: You give off negative energy.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can assure you, Mister Yappi, I'm a believer in psychic ability.

speaker: YAPPI
line: So you say with your mouth but your thoughts tell me the truth.

speaker: CLINE
line: Agent Mulder, please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can't take you anywhere.

speaker: YAPPI
line: Now, if you'll excuse me, I have an interview to give. Skeptics like you make me sick.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mister Yappi, read this thought.

speaker: YAPPI
line: So's your old man!

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's too bad about your "negative energy," Mulder, you missed quite a performance.

speaker: CLINE
line: Look what he did to my pen.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, let me impress you with my psychic ability. Mister Yappi proclaimed the victim's body would be found near water, he saw a church or a school in the vicinity, he got a flash of the letter "S" and/or the number "seven."

speaker: CLINE
line: So what's your point?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, his leads are so vague as to be practically useless yet easily interpreted to be correct after the fact.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He said the killer doesn't feel in control of his own life but that's true of everyone at times.

speaker: CLINE
line: He said a lot of things.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, and some are bound by percentages to be right but most will turn out wrong. Now, which is which?

speaker: CLINE
line: Look, all I know is that so far, Yappi has provided more solid, concrete leads on this case than you have. Now, if you don't mind, I have to get an A.P.B. out on a white male, age seventeen to thirty-four, with or without a beard, maybe a tattoo... who's impotent. Let's go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Might as well go home, Mulder, this case is as good as solved.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: So General Mutual has a very comprehensive two-hundred thousand dollar life policy at a net annual cost of twenty-four hundred dollars.

speaker: YOUNG HUSBAND
line: You see, the thing is... we were really hoping to buy a boat.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Mister Gordon, uh, as a young husband, I think you're going to find that your new responsibilities to your family take precedent over your recreational needs.

speaker: YOUNG HUSBAND
line: But this is a really good boat.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: You don't get it, do you, kid? Two years from now, while driving down Route 91... coming home to your wife and baby daughter... you're going to be hit head-on by a drunk... driving a blue '87 mustang. You'll end up looking worse than sixty feet of bad road your body slides across... after flying out your front windshield.

speaker: YOUNG HUSBAND
line: Mister... you really need to work on your closing technique.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Oh, no, no, no, no. Not your lighter, Mrs. Lowe. I wa, I want your garbage. Get out of here, you monster. Is everything all right, Mrs. Lowe? Do you have enough supplies? You have enough dog food? Oh, God.

speaker: CLINE
line: It's kind of creepy, isn't it? The Stupendous Yappi said the first victim's body would be dumped somewhere, then we find it in a dumpster.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oooh, I just got a chill down my spine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who found the body?

speaker: SCULLY
line: According to the police report, Mister Bruckman, you didn't touch the body after you found her.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Why would I want to?

speaker: SCULLY
line: But you reported that you found a body with its eyes cut out. The body was face down. If you didn't move it, how did you know the eyes had been removed?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Well, they had been, hadn't they? Then what are you complaining about?

speaker: MULDER
line: How had the eyes been cut out?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: By a piece of crystal ball, of all cockamamie things.

speaker: MULDER
line: We did find some crystal shards on the body, how do you know it was from a crystal ball?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Well, well, it just, it just figures, I mean, uh... if a guy goes to kill a fortune teller, uh, he's obviously going to assault her with her own crystal ball and, uh, use the shattered piece as a sort of lance. Isn't he?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mister Bruckman, how much have you heard about the recent slayings in town?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Just that some nut is going around killing fortune tellers and ripping their eyes and entrails out.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you know about the entrails? That information hasn't been released to the press.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I never read the papers. Too depressing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mister Bruckman? Sorry, Mister Bruckman, but I'm going to have to ask you to come with us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Step inside, Mister Bruckman.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Why, what, what is this all about?

speaker: MULDER
line: A murder occurred here earlier this evening and we have reason to believe that it was committed by the same person who murdered the woman that you found. Is there anything you can tell us about it?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I didn't do it.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're not under suspicion... but I do harbor a suspicion that you can see things about this crime... things that we can't see.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I'm, I'm not sure I understand what you mean.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you do.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Yeah, yeah, right. I'd, uh, like to see both your badges again, right now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't blame you, Mister Bruckman.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I'm supposed to believe that's a real name? What is this all about? I found a dead body in my dumpster. I, I, I reported it to the police. And now suddenly, I'm accused of doing things? Or, or being able to do things that I couldn't poss...

speaker: MULDER
line: Pinch me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This guy's performing the same routine as the Stupendous Yappi, he's just doing it in a different style.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, something told me, Scully, something is telling me this guy's for real.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, so now you're psychic?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: The killer... he doesn't feel like he's in control of his own life. I mean, like... who is, am I right? But this guy... he truly believes it. He sees himself as some kind of a... a puppet.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can you describe him? Do you get a visual impression of him?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you can see into him but not at him. I'm sorry, I didn't mean to give any negative energy.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Negative energy, what is this...

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it? What do you see?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: He's having sex with her. There.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is he raping her?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Oh, no, no, no, not at all. In fact, she's instigating the whole thing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then what's wrong?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Oh... sometimes, it... it just seems that everyone's having sex except for me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mister Bruckman, can you tell us why the killer is murdering people in the way that he is?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Why does anyone do the things they do? Why do I sell insurance? I wish I knew. Why did this woman collect dolls? What was it about her life? Was it one specific moment where she suddenly said, "I know... dolls." Or was it a whole series of things? Starting when her parents first met that somehow combined in such a way that in the end, she had no choice but to be a doll colle... You'll find the woman tomorrow morning... by the fat, little, white Nazi stormtrooper. Glenview Lake. Her body's floating in Glenview Lake. Now, if you'll excuse me... I think I've seen enough death for one night.

speaker: DIVER
line: One more... here we go...

speaker: WOMAN
line: From around here, you say?

speaker: MULDER
line: Be honest, Scully. Doesn't that propane tank bear more than just a slight resemblance to a fat, little, white Nazi stormtrooper?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the human mind naturally seeks meaningful patterns and configurations in things that don't inherently have any. Given the suggestion of a particular image, you can't help but see that shape somewhere. If that tank weren't there, you'd see it in a, in a rock or in a tree...

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you answer my question?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, it looks like a fat, little, white Nazi stormtrooper but that only proves my point.

speaker: MULDER
line: He named the specific body of water the victim would be found in.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that only implies that he was the one who put her in there.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't believe he's the killer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't believe he's psychic.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, if he's not, then how did he know where the body would be found?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe he's just lucky.

speaker: WOMAN ON RADIO
line: Thirty-eight, forty and forty-four. Once again, the winning lotto numbers are...

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Why?

speaker: WOMAN ON RADIO
line: ...eight, twelve...

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Why do I do this to myself? Come in. I knew it was you. I know why you're here. You're here because you found that woman's body where I told you it would be. And now you're convinced I have some kind of psychic power. So while your skeptical lady partner is off performing an autopsy, you came here to ask my help catching this serial murderer.

speaker: MULDER
line: Everything you said is correct.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Oh, it's you. I won't help you. Please leave.

speaker: MULDER
line: But you do admit to having this gift.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Oh, I got it, all right. The only problem is, it's non-returnable.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mister Bruckman, you possess an ability that not only has staggering implications upon physics and human consciousness, but it's one which most people, myself included, would be envious of. Yet you seem to treat it with disdain.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Do you want to know how you're going to die?

speaker: MULDER
line: Y, yes, I would.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: No, you don't. Of course, not knowing has its own drawbacks which is why a good insurance policy is so important. I, I don't know what kind of coverage the F.B.I. has, but, uh, General Mutual has...

speaker: MULDER
line: Mister Bruckman, this murderer has already committed four homicides.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: And he'll commit more whether I help you or not.

speaker: MULDER
line: How can you be so sure?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: How can I see the future if it didn't already exist?

speaker: MULDER
line: Then if the future is written, then why bother to do anything?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Now you're catching on.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mister Bruckman, I believe in your ability but not your attitude. I can't stand by and watch people die without doing everything in my, albeit unsupernatural, power to interfere with that fate.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Well, you see, that's another reason I can't help you catch this guy. I might adversely affect the fate of the future. I mean, his next victim might be the mother of the daughter whose son invents the time machine. Then the son goes back in time and changes world history and then Columbus never discovers America, man never lands on the moon, the U.S. never invades Grenada... Or something less significant... resulting in the fact that my father never meets my mother and consequently, I'm never born. So when do we start?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I don't know what it is but it belonged to one of the victims.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's a hit. In psychical research parlance, a correct answer's a "hit," an incorrect answer's a "miss."

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: The guy who cast the mold for this will die of prostate cancer at the age of eighty-two. Hit or miss?

speaker: MULDER
line: I have no way of verifying that information.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Then why'd you ask me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you receive any other impressions from it?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: It's ugly. Next.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was told you were interrogating a suspect but something tells me...

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm now convinced of our psychic's abilities, Scully, or rather, his one ability. He is able to divine how people are going to die but that's all. He can't provide any practical information on our case.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I got it! This is yours. This is from your New York Knicks t-shirt!

speaker: MULDER
line: Miss.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: This is worse than playing the lotto.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Try reading this.

speaker: MULDER
line: Save me the headache, Scully, what is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was found on the woman that was pulled from the lake. Identical keychains were found on two of the other victims. I managed to trace the insignia to an investment firm called Uranus Unlimited. They provide market strategies based on astrological forecasts. And the company is owned by a man named...

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Claude Dukenfield. Age forty-three. 316 Roundview Lane. Divorced with two children. Makes about eighty-seven thousand a year. Non-smoker.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that a hit or a miss?

speaker: SCULLY
line: As far as I know, that's correct.

speaker: MULDER
line: You got all that information just by handling that keychain?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Oh, no. I sold him a policy a couple of months ago. Just a coincidence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In any case, we're trying to get a hold of him.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Oh, you won't be able to do that. He's been murdered.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: We're almost there.

speaker: MULDER
line: How are you receiving this information about the body's location?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: How should I know?

speaker: MULDER
line: I mean, are you seeing it in a vision or is it a... sensation? How do you know where to go?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I just know.

speaker: MULDER
line: But how do you know?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I don't know! Look, it's just up ahead. You know, there are worse ways to go, but I can't think of a more undignified way than autoerotic asphyxiation.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why are you telling me that?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Look, forget I mentioned it. It's none of my business. Oops, pull over here. Stop. This is the spot. I guess you run into a lot of dead bodies in your line of work.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You get used to it.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I never have. I'm not sure you're supposed to.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you remember the first time you foresaw someone's death?

speaker: MULDER
line: What happened in 1959?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Buddy Holly's plane crashed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You prognosticated Buddy Holly's death?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Oh, God, no. Why would I want to do that? But I did have a ticket to see him perform the next night. Actually, I was a bigger fan of the Big Bopper than Buddy Holly. "Chantilly Lace," that was the song.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not following.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: There's... the Big Bopper was not supposed to be on the plane with Buddy Holly. He won the seat from somebody else by flipping a coin for it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm still not following.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Imagine all the things that had to occur, not only in his life, but in everybody else's, to arrange it so on that particular night, the Big Bopper would be in a position to live or die depending on a flipping coin. I became so obsessed with that idea that I gradually became capable of seeing the specifics of everybody's death.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, Mister Bruckman, I'm not one who readily believes in that kind of thing and if I was, I still wouldn't believe that story.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I know it sounds crazy, but I swear it's true. I was a bigger fan of the Big Bopper than Buddy Holly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where's the body?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, Mister Bruckman, I don't understand how you can know that this is the exact area, but you can't pinpoint the exact spot.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I guess I can't see the forest for the trees.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, now. I'm glad I could bring a little smile into your life, Mister Bruckman.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I'm not smiling, I'm wincing.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: What's this?

speaker: MULDER
line: The only evidence recovered from Claude Dukenfield's body. That fiber may have come from something the killer was wearing at the time of the crime.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Don't you have crime labs that analyze these things for you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, yes, we do.

speaker: MULDER
line: But it'll take them time to provide any information. A similar fiber was found on one of the earlier victims and we're still waiting for the lab to determine it's source. You'd be saving us a great deal of work.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Look, I've got my own work to do. I'm not a crime fighter by trade.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mister Bruckman... I can't speak for my partner but I'm desperate... for some insurance.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: General Mutual has some very comprehensive coverage... No... I, I can't tell you where this is from, but, but... the killer's going to kill more people before you catch him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Can you see him physically yet?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: No, no, just more insight into his character, which I know you hate. He thinks he's psychic.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is he?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I hope not. I've seen some of the things he's "seen."

speaker: MULDER
line: Like what? What does he see?

speaker: MULDER IN VISION
line: Hey!

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: You. He sees you. Trying to catch him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where does this take place?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: In a kitchen. You're looking around for someone. He's behind you now, but you don't know it and he's stalking towards you and... and... Oh, God!

speaker: SCULLY
line: What? What do you see?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: He's got a knife. It's got blood on it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, why don't I see him, what am I doing?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: You're looking down. You stepped in a pie that's fallen to the floor. The killer comes up to you and... Coconut cream.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: The pie... eh, coconut cream or, or is it lemon merengue? I don't know, it's... not sure, it's, it's hazy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever, please continue.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: As you're looking down, he comes up with the knife and... Banana cream! Definitely banana cream.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, I'm looking down at this banana cream pie and then what...

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: He sees himself coming up to you from behind...

speaker: MULDER
line: And? And, what does he see?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Oh... Nothing. They're visions of a madman.

speaker: MULDER
line: You got all that from this?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: How am I supposed to get anything from this tiny little thing? This came in the mail today.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who's it from?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: The killer!

speaker: MULDER
line: "To whom it may concern. Like our lives, this is a mere formality to let you know I know that you know. Can't wait till our first meeting when I kill you. Not before you explain some things to me. First on the list, why in the world did I send you this letter? Sincerely, you know who. P.S., say 'hi' to the F.B.I. agents."

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He must've been at the crime scenes, seeing you with us.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, this letter is postmarked the day before Mister Bruckman joined our investigation. You're going to have to come with us, Mister Bruckman. We're got to get you out of here.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Look... I'll be dead before you catch this guy, no matter what you do.

speaker: TAROT DEALER
line: You've come to me because you're searching for someone. But don't worry, this person will find you. It's a relative or a close friend.

speaker: PUPPET
line: Actually, a guy I'm going to kill.

speaker: TAROT DEALER
line: Ah, yes, it's clearer now. You seek answers from a special man who possesses a special wisdom.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: This is real cream. Not the phony stuff. I know the difference. And the chocolate, very rich. Look at these cute little doilies they put everything on. You sure you don't want to join me? So what are you doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Studying background checks. This is what detective work is really like. We can't come up with suspects by having visions.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Jealous?

speaker: TAROT DEALER
line: You're very confused right now. Nothing seems to make sense to you. You don't know why you do the things that you do. But your confusion is soon to come to an abrupt end with the arrival of a woman. A blonde or a brunette. Maybe a redhead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's something you haven't explained. Can you see your own end?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I see our end. We end up in bed together. I'm, I'm, I'm sorry. I shouldn't have said that, I, I, I don't mean to offend you or scare you, but, uh, not here, not this bed. I, I just mean I, I see us quite clearly in bed together. You're holding me hand, uh... very tenderly and then... you're looking at me with such compassion and I feel... tears are streaming down my face. I feel so grateful. It's just a... very special moment neither of us will ever forget.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mister Bruckman... there are hits and there are misses. And then there are misses.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I just call 'em as I see 'em.

speaker: PUPPET
line: Wow, I'm really impressed. I've been to a lot of fortune tellers, but, by far, you're the best.

speaker: TAROT DEALER
line: There's still one more card left.

speaker: PUPPET
line: This card's not meant for me. It's yours.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, Ahab mistakes the prophecy and as a result, dies. A similar fate happens to MacBeth.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Still, you're not the least bit curious?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That must be Mulder. Time for the midnight shift. All right. So how do I die?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: You don't.

speaker: MULDER
line: Get this, Scully. The lab analysis from the first bit of fiber that was found just came back. It's lace.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Chantilly lace?

speaker: MULDER
line: You know what I like.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's not likely that the killer was wearing anything made out of chantilly lace at the time of the murders.

speaker: MULDER
line: But what are the odds of the Big Bopper, "Chantilly lace..."

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's a coincidence.

speaker: MULDER
line: If coincidences are just coincidences, why do they feel so contrived?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's one to pose to the psychic philosopher. Good night, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Am I keeping you awake?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I'm waiting for you to ask me another one of those psychic ability questions.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I've had dreams in my life where I had a vision and then later on, I've seen that vision in reality and then... and as a psychic, have you ever had prophetic dreams like that?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I have only one dream. I dream it ever night. You're not one of those people who turns everything into a sexual symbol, are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, I'm not a Freudian, no.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I'm lying naked in a field of red tulips. I'm not concerned with where I am or how I got there. I'm at peace and it's then that I realize I'm dead. My body begins to turn a greenish-white with spots of purple. Next, the insects arrive. The inevitable follows, putridity and liquescence. Before I know it, I'm nothing but bones. When I start fading to dust, I lose whatever care I still might have had about where my clothes are and as I begin to feel myself slipping away towards I know not what... I wake up. Well, good night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, there's... are you okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, yeah. I just didn't sleep well. What's up?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Havez is going to stay with Bruckman while we go over to a tarot card reader around the corner. There's been another murder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm beginning to lose patience with our psychic, Scully. What good are his prophecies if they're not preventive?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Actually, I'm starting to feel more sympathetic towards him.

speaker: MULDER
line: So, you're convinced he's a psychic now?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, no, not really.

speaker: PUPPET
line: Sorry, ma'am.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But I am convinced that by thinking he can see the future, he's taken all the joy out of his life.

speaker: HAVEZ
line: So then the priest says to the rabbi...

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: "I had it set for quail."

speaker: HAVEZ
line: Yeah! Hey, I thought you said you hadn't heard that one before.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I hadn't.

speaker: HAVEZ
line: Hey... is it true that you can see how people are going to die? I mean, can you see how I'm going to die? Lung cancer? Thank God. Hey, I got to go visit your restroom for a second. Don't open that door for anybody.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Oh, God. Was that not enough of a tip?

speaker: PUPPET
line: They brought you right to me, right to where I work.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: What are the chances of that happening?

speaker: PUPPET
line: They're astronomical! It's beyond believability.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: But not impossibility. I mean, after all, here we are.

speaker: PUPPET
line: It's funny how things work out sometimes, isn't it?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: I'll say.

speaker: PUPPET
line: So there's something I've been wanting to ask you for some time now. You've seen the things I do in the past as well as in the future.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: They're terrible things.

speaker: PUPPET
line: I know they are. So, tell me, please, why have I done them?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: Don't you understand yet, son? Don't you get it? You do the things you do because you're a homicidal maniac.

speaker: PUPPET
line: That... that does explain a lot, doesn't it? It's all starting to make sense now.

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: No. You don't kill me now.

speaker: PUPPET
line: I don't? Why not?

speaker: CLYDE BRUCKMAN
line: How should I know?

speaker: HAVEZ
line: No!

speaker: MULDER
line: Now, we've either got a copycat killer or our guy's getting extremely lackadaisical.

speaker: CLINE
line: Not only did he leave the body, but he didn't even bother to remove the eyes.

speaker: MAN OUTSIDE
line: What happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: If my Miss Manners serves me right, that protrusion from his left cornea is a salad fork.

speaker: CLINE
line: Something tells me we're going to get prints off it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I found another strand of that silk.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah, we've got more than that this time, Scully. We've got fingerprints, probably a footprint even.

speaker: CLINE
line: Yeah, this is more like it. No more psychics and their vague visions and predictions. Hell, we don't even need our own hunches. This case is just now about good old-fashioned forensic police work.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's the bellhop. He's the killer, the bellhop at the hotel!

speaker: CLINE
line: How the hell does she know that?

speaker: MULDER
line: Woman's intuition.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Havez? Mister Bruckman?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Drop it!

speaker: PUPPET
line: Hey... that's not the way it's supposed to happen.

speaker: MULDER
line: How'd you know where to find us?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I didn't. I got on the service elevator by mistake.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thank heaven for happenstance.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know, none of Bruckman's prophecy came true. The killer didn't get to him first, but he did kill Havez.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then Bruckman is all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Actually, I don't know. I couldn't find him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then where is he?

speaker: MULDER
line: "Miss Scully."

speaker: SCULLY
line: "My neighbor, Mrs. Lowe, passed away last night. Please see that the remains of her remains are taken care of. Would you like a dog? He's paper-trained and well-behaved, regardless of his actions last night, which you can't really blame him for."

speaker: OLIVER HARDY ON TV
line: Well, here's another nice mess you've gotten me into.

speaker: STAN LAUREL ON TV
line: Well, I couldn't help it.

speaker: OLIVER HARDY ON TV
line: Come on. Let's get back to Peoria where we belong.

speaker: YAPPI ON TV
line: Do you want to know the future? Do you want to know what lies ahead? Then call me, the Stupendous Yappi. For years, I have entertained audiences with my psychic abilities. I have been consulted by Hollywood stars, police departments... even presidents. Now, I can be your personal psychic consultant. Do you want to know if you will get that promotion? Do you want to know if your marriage will be successful? Do you want to know where you will meet your one true love? Then call me at 1-900-555-Yapp. Remember, the future is close at hand and so is your phone. So to hear tomorrow's secrets today, just pick it up. I know you will. I can see your future.
